intro: Mentzelia nuda var. rusbyi, commonly known as the naked mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color and bloom during the summer months. It is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
